message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with the problems of secret sharing and multiparty computation, which are fundamental topics in cryptography and theoretical computer science. The focus of the paper is on the rational behavior of agents, which suggests that it belongs to the category of computer security and cryptography (cs.CR). The paper also involves information theory (cs.IT) as it deals with the sharing of secret information. The use of randomized mechanisms and expected running time suggests that it may also belong to the categories of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS), computational complexity (cs.CC), and game theory (cs.GT).
